content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Yi-Nuo Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in München. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Hello Yi-Nuo, it's a pleasure to meet you. I'm sure you'll find my apartment in München to be a comfortable and convenient place to live. How much are you considering to pay for the rent?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, your apartment does seem quite nice and the location is very central, which is certainly a plus. As for the rent, I'm open to discussing a fair price that reflects the value of the apartment and the amenities it offers. Could you please tell me your initial thoughts on the rental price?
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Thank you for your kind words, Yi-Nuo. I'm sure we can find a price that suits both our needs. My initial thought is that the apartment is worth at least €1,500 per month, given its size, location, and the fact that it's newly built. What do you think about this price?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, €1,500 is a significant amount for an unfurnished one-bedroom apartment. While I appreciate the quality and the location, I would like to propose a more reasonable price. How about €1,200 per month? I believe this would be a fair reflection of the current market rate for similar apartments in the city center.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: €1,200 is quite a bit lower than what I had in mind, Yi-Nuo. However, I'm willing to negotiate. How about we meet in the middle at €1,350 per month? This would be a fair compromise, don't you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, meeting in the middle at €1,350 is a more acceptable proposition. While it's still higher than my initial offer, the location and the quality of the apartment are certainly worth considering. I would agree to this price.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: I'm glad to hear that, Yi-Nuo. It's a pleasure doing business with you. I agree to the price of €1,350 Euro! Would you like to discuss any other terms or conditions?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I'm also pleased with our agreement. As for other terms and conditions, I would like to discuss the possibility of a one-year lease with the option to renew. Additionally, I would appreciate if we could include a clause that outlines the process for any necessary repairs during the lease period. Would you be willing to discuss these points?
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Certainly, Yi-Nuo. I'm open to discussing a one-year lease with the option to renew. As for the repair clause, I can assure you that I will be responsible for any necessary repairs that arise during the lease period, provided they are not due to tenant negligence. Would you like to discuss any other terms or are we ready to proceed with the lease agreement?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, your commitment to maintaining the apartment is reassuring. Regarding the lease agreement, I would like to propose a small change. Instead of a one-year lease, could we consider a 10-month lease with the option to renew for an additional 2 months? This would give me the flexibility to explore other living options if needed, while still having the security of a longer lease if I decide to stay. Would this be a possibility?
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: I understand your desire for flexibility, Yi-Nuo. A 10-month lease with the option to renew for an additional 2 months is an interesting proposal. I'm open to this arrangement. Would you agree to a slightly higher rent for this flexibility, say €1,400 per month? This would still be a fair price considering the apartment's location and amenities. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, your counteroffer of €1,400 per month for the 10-month lease with the two-month renewal option is quite fair. I appreciate the added value of the flexibility you're offering. I agree to this price. Is there anything else we need to discuss before proceeding with the lease agreement?
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Excellent, Yi-Nuo. It's settled then. We have a deal at €1,400 per month for the 10-month lease with the two-month renewal option. I'll prepare the lease agreement and we can meet to sign the documents. Is there anything specific you would like to include in the agreement regarding repairs or other responsibilities?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I would like to ensure that any pre-existing issues with the apartment are documented and that we have a clear process for communicating and addressing any future maintenance needs. Additionally, I would like to clarify the responsibilities for utility payments, such as electricity and water. Other than that, I trust that the standard lease agreement will cover the rest.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Absolutely, Yi-Nuo. I will ensure that any pre-existing issues are documented, and we'll outline a clear process for maintenance requests. As for utilities, the tenant is typically responsible for electricity and water, while the landlord covers the costs of sewage and trash collection. We'll include these details in the lease agreement. Is there anything else you would like to discuss or clarify before we finalize the lease?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, your explanation of utility responsibilities is clear. I have no further questions or clarifications regarding that. Before we finalize the lease, I would like to ensure that the apartment is in a clean and livable condition upon my move-in. Additionally, I would appreciate a grace period of one week after the lease begins to make any minor adjustments or repairs that I may deem necessary. Would you agree to these terms?
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Certainly, Yi-Nuo. I will ensure that the apartment is in a clean and livable condition before you move in. And I'm more than willing to grant you a grace period of one week after the lease begins to make any minor adjustments or repairs that you may deem necessary. This is a standard practice in landlord-tenant relationships, and I'm happy to accommodate it. Is there anything else you would like to discuss or agree upon before we proceed with the lease agreement?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, your willingness to provide a clean apartment and a grace period is much appreciated. I have no further requests or discussions at this time. Let's proceed with the lease agreement as discussed. I'm looking forward to a smooth and amicable tenancy. Thank you for your time and professionalism.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: You're welcome, Yi-Nuo. I'm glad we've been able to reach an agreement that satisfies both parties. I will prepare the lease agreement and we can meet to sign the documents. Once again, thank you for choosing my apartment. I'm looking forward to a long and fruitful relationship. TERMINATE
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
